page.title: 11Skelmanthorpe fire station
page.content: Kirklees Division. Nucleus station (2 full time men on duty) 5 full-time men and 15 part-time. Training for full-time officers - 3months; for part-time officers - weekly sessions continually assessed. Age of firemen:18 to 55 years. Approx 6 calls per week. Most common call:chimney fires. Special calls humanitarian, industry and homes. Radio paging (using alerters) is used to call part-time firemen. It takes approx 2-3 mins for men to assemble and mount the engines. Each engine carries 6 men. Most can drive. The engine carries: breathing apparatus,hose pipes,pumping machine, hatchets, ropes, special fire-fighting uniforms,steel cutting machinery, crow-bars, ladders, etc. This station serves Skelmanthorpe, Scissett, Emley, Flockton, Clayton West and Upper Denby.
